analysis_summary.problem_statement: Investigate two-dimensional electron gas (2DEG) formation at hydrogen-terminated SiC surfaces through systematic DFT calculations. The study aims to understand how surface orientation and H-termination configuration influence electronic properties near the Fermi level, potentially revealing metallic surface states characteristic of 2DEG systems.
analysis_summary.computational_approach: Density Functional Theory (DFT) using VASP with PBEsol functional for accurate surface properties, D3 dispersion correction for weak interactions, and spin-polarized calculations. Surface slab models with 15-20 Å vacuum spacing and dipole correction to avoid spurious interactions.
key_challenges: Accurate Fermi level positioning for 2DEG detection
Surface slab convergence with respect to thickness and vacuum
Proper treatment of surface dipoles and charge redistribution
Systematic sampling of surface terminations and configurations
Distinguishing true 2DEG states from surface resonances
expected_outcomes: Electronic band structures showing metallic surface states
Layer-resolved DOS revealing charge confinement at surface
Surface formation energies for stability analysis

phase_1.name: Bulk SiC Optimization
phase_1.description: Optimize bulk SiC polymorphs (3C, 4H, 6H) as reference for surface calculations

phase_2.name: Surface Model Construction
phase_2.description: Generate surface slabs with different orientations and H-terminations

phase_3.name: Electronic Structure Calculations
phase_3.description: Comprehensive electronic structure analysis for 2DEG detection
calculations: Self-consistent field (SCF) with high k-point density

phase_4.name: Transport Properties
phase_4.method: Finite differences for effective masses, BoltzTraP for transport coefficients

kpoints_content: KPOINTS file (content should be provided by AI)

#!/bin/bash
#SBATCH -p cpu
#SBATCH -N 1
#SBATCH --ntasks-per-node=48
#SBATCH -J SiC surfaces with H-termination_20251019_135907
#SBATCH -o vasp.out
#SBATCH -t 02:00:00

module load app/vasp/6.3.2/cpu
export VASP_PP_PATH=/public/apps/vasp/6.3.2/potentials/pbe

echo "Starting VASP calculation for SiC surfaces with H-termination_20251019_135907"
echo "Start time: $(date)"
echo "Job ID: $SLURM_JOB_ID"
echo "Nodes: $SLURM_JOB_NUM_NODES"
echo "Tasks: $SLURM_NTASKS"

# Build POTCAR (example - should be customized based on elements)

mpirun -np $SLURM_NTASKS vasp_std

echo "VASP calculation completed"
echo "End time: $(date)"
